org.dgfoundation.amp.algo.timing

Class InclusiveTimer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dgfoundation.amp.algo.timing.InclusiveTimer

  • public class InclusiveTimer
extends java.lang.Object
    reentrant, multiple-threads-safe timer which can track how much a task and its subtasks took by modelling the runtime through a tree This class is thread-safe

      • treeLeaves

        protected final VivificatingMap<java.lang.Thread,java.util.Stack<RunTree>> treeLeaves
        a task (e.g. fetching/calculating lots of data items) can have its subtasks run on different threads. The tasks run in these threads are logically subtasks of the parent task

      • retiredRoots

        protected final java.util.List<RunTree> retiredRoots

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run(java.lang.String name,
                ExceptionRunnable<?> runnable)
        runs a task oblivious to the multithreaded capabilities of the timer. It is a simple forwarder to run(String, TimedTask, RunNode) which uses the task which lastly run in this runner/thread as a parent
        This approximation is good enough even for multithreaded code, as long as threads are not reused for unrelated tasks
        Parameters:
        name -
        runnable -

        runs a task and lets it know the runtime id of the code, so that the code can know its id and pass it on down the call stack
